intro: Psoralea rigidula, commonly known as the rigid psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Psoralea rigidula is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal dunes.
